main_point: The professor explains Karst aquifers and sinkhole formation and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes mantle convection (a process) from tomography (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving isotope ratio and magma chamber.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about an ethics aside to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for seismic wave shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
